pages.text: An area of the Nether covered with a thick layer of hot, smoldering ashes. Strange blue flames are scattered around the landscape, broken up by small pools of lava. The $(thing)ash$() is a bit tready to walk in.$(br2)It can be reasonably assumed this place was the hotspot of ancient volcanic activity, or some sort of scorching which left ash.

This biome is fairly devoid of life; not much is offered here for anything that's living, between the ash that's sluggish to walk around in and the fire that makes you move without any rhyme or reason.$(br2)There isn't much else to say about this place, although it does contain a few points of interest for materials that could come in handy down the line:

pages.title: Cursed Fire
pages.text: This strange blue flame isn't hot enough to burn me; however, it takes control of my movement, causing me to flail about wildly. I should be quite careful or I may get thrown into lava against my will!$(br2)It can be picked up with a $(thing)jar$() and placed down elsewhere, crafted as so:
However, as hazardous as this fire might be, putting it strategically around traps near my base might cause monsters to fall right into them...$(br2)The monsters won't know what happened!

pages.title: Ashes
pages.text: Lots of ash can be found here. When dug up, I get a few $(thing)piles of ash$().$(br2)Compressing the piles of ash together by crafting yields the more substantial ash that is found here; compressing that even further will get me a nice piece of $(thing)coal$().
